titleStmt.title: John R. Heald to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6436

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Dear Sir I recd yours stating that I did not tell you the charge for which I was fined. It was for selling Liquor to a minor I was decieved about the boys age he told me he was of age but it was proven that he was not further the spirits did not belong to me it was the property of my father in law but I sold the liquor of Course I had to be responsible the charge is Just If I was able to pay the fine & live it would be diferent but I am entiree broke up by the Guerilas perhaps before you get this I may be confined in
Boyd Co Jail if it was saving my life I could not pay it Please forward the remit to Col Laban T Moore of Catletsburg Boyd Co Ky

I Remain your Humble Servt
John R Heald
Late of Co L 1st Reg't C G
Dear Gov please relieve me in hast if possible for information of me ask Col P B Hawkins
